"Pitchers and Catchers" refers to early spring training in baseball - players who arrive before the rest of the team. Originally this early group was mostly comprised of pitchers and catchers, because the long pitcher roster needed to be winnowed. These days, players of all positions arrive to spring training early, but the term "Pitchers and Catchers" has stuck

in geology, relative dating is when you compare whether one rock is older than another. Several principles are used in relative dating: lower layers are older than layers above, intruding pieces are younger than the intruded area, and the same laws of physics acted on in historic times as today.

there are three main types of compost: anaerobic, aerobic, and vermiculture. In anaerobic, you put all the compost in a pile and bacteria heats it up and degrade it. In aerobic compsoting, you turn the soil, introducing aeration. In vermiculture, worms live in the compost and aerate and degrade it

Arkansas and Kansas are pronounced differently because they have different etymologies. Arkansas was named for the French plural of a Native American tribe, while Kansas is the English spelling of a similarly named tribe.

Albuquerque hosts the world's largest hot air balloon festival. ABQ is ideal for ballooning because of the "Albuquerque Box" - a meterological phenomenon by which low air moves southerly and high air moves northerly. This enables hot air balloons to land close to where they take off, relatively easily

In Fort Bend County, TX, after slavery was abolished, they used a convict workaround, whereby able-bodied mostly Black men were falsely imprisoned and essentially worked as slaves in the field. Nowadays, those prison slaves are buried in Fort Bend and there are regulations on development on top of the burial ground. Unfortunately, these regulations are ignored and Fort Bend continues to be developed without proper care to avoid these burial grounds.

Freedom House is the first EMS service in the US. It was started in a historically black neighborhood in Pittsburgh. Previously, ambulance services only sought to get patients to the hospital as quickly as possible - The Freedom House was novel in that it provided life saving care en route to the hospital.
